The community (including the rural areas around Hagfors) is spread across 1,833 square kilometres, and has a population of ca 13,000.
Hagfors has a beautiful nature with lot of water and plenty of forest. The landscape is characterized by larger and smaller lakes with rolling hills around.
Iron industry has been and still is important for Hagfors. 
Tourism is growing and many activities are offered for visitors.
Besides the general travel information presented in
site, there are flight from Stockholm to Hagfors and Torsby
Hagfors is connected via the bike road Klarälvsbanan

to Karlstad.
In Hagfors, all sites can be walked to.
Travel by bus

to touristic destinations requires most often foot walks (and a map) since destinations are a bit further away from the main roads. 
The most easy way of travel is by car.

value: is a festival which is arranged annually in beginning of July. It presents many traditional handicrafts as they were performed for 100 years ago. It takes place on a homestead museum, so that many types of old houses are displayed at the same time.
Moose safaris are arranged by several organizers.
Industrial museums are in Stjärnfors kvarn

Fishing: You need to buy a fishing license.
Paddling: Several places rent kayaks and canoes.
Rent a draisine and go back and forth between Stjärnfors to Hagfors
Build a raft and use it for travel in Klarälven.
